conclusion: The graph shows position as a function of time; slope represents velocity.
The slope of the line in the graph is constant.
The slope can be calculated using the formula slope = Δx/Δt.
Change in position Δx = 10 meters; change in time Δt = 2 seconds.
Calculate slope: slope = 10 m / 2 s = 5 m/s.
The slope of the x-t graph is the velocity, which is 5 m/s.
Since the graph is a straight line, the velocity is constant.
Constant velocity means there is no change in velocity over time.
The acceleration is the rate of change of velocity. Since velocity is constant, acceleration is zero.
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 0 m/s².
